channel.title: NetBeans Screencasts and Video Demos
channel.description: Screencasts that show you all the cool features of NetBeans, the free and open-source IDE for Java development and scripting.

item.title: JDK 7 Support in NetBeans IDE 7.0
item.description: This screencast demonstrates the support for new JDK 7 language features in NetBeans IDE 7.0.

item.title: Deploying a Web App to Oracle WebLogic Server
item.description: This screencast shows support for the Oracle WebLogic server in NetBeans IDE. See how to register an instance of the server with the IDE and then deploy a Java EE 5 web application..

item.title: Generating PHP Documentation With NetBeans IDE
item.description: This screencast shows how to use PHPDocumentor with NetBeans IDE.

item.title: Rename Refactoring and Other Editor Improvements in NetBeans IDE 7.0 for PHP
item.description: This screencast shows the new features of the PHP editor in NetBeans IDE 7.0

item.title: Zend Framework Support in the NetBeans IDE
item.description: This screencast demonstrates how to develop PHP applications using Zend Framework in the NetBeans IDE.

item.title: Designing a Swing GUI in NetBeans IDE
item.description: This screencast walks you through designing a Swing GUI in the NetBeans IDE.

item.title: Rename Refactoring and Other Editor Improvements in NetBeans IDE 7.0 for PHP
item.description: This screencast shows the new features of the PHP editor in NetBeans IDE 7.0

item.title: Using New Data Sources in JavaFX Composer
item.description: This demo shows how to create a form that displays data from an XML file in JavaFX Composer.

item.title: PHP Support in the NetBeans IDE
item.description: A high-level overview of the NetBeans IDE's support for dynamic languages, such as PHP.

item.title: Creating an Animated NetBeans Logo Application in JavaFX Composer
item.description: Quickly create a small demo with animated graphics using the NetBeans JavaFX Composer.

item.title: Editing Java Code in NetBeans IDE
item.description: This demonstration walks you through the creation of a simple Java application in the Java Editor of NetBeans IDE 6.9.1

item.title: Deploying a Web Application to the Oracle WebLogic Server
item.description: This screencast shows support for the Oracle WebLogic server in NetBeans IDE 6.10 Milestone 1. See how to register an instance of the server with the IDE and then deploy a Java EE 5 web application.

item.title: Using JavaFX Composer in NetBeans IDE 6.9
item.description: The JavaFX Composer is a visual layout tool for building JavaFX GUI applications, similar to the Swing GUI Builder for Java SE applications.

item.title: NetBeans Platform 6.9
item.description: An overview of the NetBeans Platform, a Swing-based framework for developing desktop applications.
